main_definition: Relating to or consisting of separate parts that can be connected or combined in different ways.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In design and architecture, referring to a structure composed of self-contained units or sections that are interchangeable.
meanings_and_examples.example: The building's modular design allowed for easy expansion as new rooms were needed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In technology and electronics, describing components that can be easily replaced or connected to other parts independently.
meanings_and_examples.example: Modular smartphones allow users to replace individual modules like camera lenses or batteries for upgrades.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In software development, it refers to a programming approach where separate components of a program are developed and tested individually before being integrated.
meanings_and_examples.example: The modular design of the application made it easier to debug and maintain individual features without affecting others.

meanings_and_examples.definition: When referring to teaching, it means breaking down complex information into smaller parts that can be taught independently.
meanings_and_examples.example: A modular syllabus divided each unit of the course into self-contained topics for easier understanding and memorization.
